intro: Mesosphaerum monticola, commonly known as the mountain mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
